edge: Joins the Indian Army after completing his master's degree and becomes a Lieutenant of Jammu and Kashmir Rifles, serving in Sopore of Jammu and Kashmir.
Serves as a Lieutenant of the regiment, stationed in Sopore of Jammu and Kashmir.
Defies his CO Lt. Sanjeev 'Jimmy' Jamwal but neutralises the perpetrators and saves Jimmy's life during a counter-insurgency operation.
Reprimands Vikram Batra's approach but gets close to him later during their service in Sopore of Jammu and Kashmir.
Wants to get married, however, Dimple's father refuses to accept Vikram because they belong to different castes.
Selected for the Merchant Navy which makes his girlfriend Dimple happy yet confused about his career.
Studied English as his major subject in college.
Wanted to join the Indian Navy during his college days.
The Delta Company, of which Vikram is also a part as lieutenant, catches an insurgent group's henchman. In retaliation,
...the leader Haider ambushes Delta Company by luring them with intel of a weapons cache.
Naib Subedar Bansi Lal is among those killed...
Traumatised and vengeful, he tracks down Haider and obtains authorisation from the unit's CO, Lt. Col. Y. K. Joshi for an operation.
Delta Company led by Vikram raids Haiderâ€™s house, killing him.
As news about a potential war gains traction, Vikram decides to cut short his vacation and return...
During the war, 13 JAK RIF regiment was tasked with recapturing Point 5140 at 17,000 feet.
Captain Vikram Batra led his company and successfully recaptured Point 5140 without casualties.
Captain Vikram Batra adopted the codename Shershaah for radio communication during the war.
Victory signal Yeh Dil Maange More was adopted by Captain Vikram Batra for radio communication during the war.
The 13 JAK RIF regiment was moved to the Ghumri Army Base as a reserve force along with other regiments to acclimatise and prepare.
The Ghumri Army Base came under artillery fire that resulted in multiple casualties, including Major Ajay Singh Jasrotia.
Captain Vikram Batra served under Major Ajay Singh Jasrotia in the Ghumri Army Base before he was promoted to the rank of Captain.
2nd Rajputana Rifles (2 RAJ RIF) regiment was previously deployed to recapture Point 5140.
13 JAK RIF regiment relieved 2nd Rajputana Rifles (2 RAJ RIF) and was tasked with recapturing Point 5140.
